Was pulling some OT when it happened.
Wanna know what I was thinking the whole time I was evacuating?
You got me.
I survive this, I'm gettin' my drink on at Seventh Heaven!
Alright, sounds like a plan! I'm free tomorrow, so let's do it!
Why did we have to come to the slums? There's trash everywhere, and the smell─
Shhh! Not so loud!
Can we even trust the hotels around here?
I bet their mattresses are crawling with bugs...
They had this one drink in Wall Market... Tasted like the nectar of the gods.
We ain't got shit like that here. How about one that tastes like their piss?
I'm just waiting for a friend.
The bartender here can take one look at you and know exactly what you want.
I need something so stiff it knocks me out.
Hey, back of the line.
Should probably figure out what I want...
Thinking about cutting in?
Think I'll order the hardest stuff they got! See if I can't get rid of a few of these memories!
Funny. You said the same thing last night.
How much is enough fried marche? A handful or, hear me out...
a whole heap?
I wish I could tell you. But sadly, I don't share your passion for processed food.
Guess some topsiders came down too. Just got asked about lodgings.
You mention the place by the watch's HQ? That's the safest, if you ask me.
Oh. My. God. Isn't that the hot new bag from Sector 2?
Yeah. I almost feel sorry for whoever they nabbed it from. Almost.
Gonna buy it?
If the price's right.
You don't wanna mess with the monsters in here. Move along now.
And just where do you think you're going, huh?
No words can describe how bright the flames were.
I'd never felt the ground shake like that.
All that debris piled up like mountains─you couldn't go nowhere!
I thought, "This is where I die."
Was like a giant candle lighting up the whole sky.
I was afraid the whole plate would come crashing down.
Sector 8 was a nightmare! Fires everywhere!
There were more injured people than the rescue workers could treat.
What's going on?
Suddenly, everyone's talking about some bomb going off?
This is terrible... What do we do?
Frightening...
What if Sector 7's next?
Well, I don't feel sorry for those holier-than-thou assholes. They had it coming.
One of my friends said they saw it burning.
I thought reactors were safe...
What's going to happen to us?
How will this affect us?
Think they'll attack Sector 7?
The topsiders brought this on themselves.
I don't know... It sounds like an accident to me.
But then what about the children? We can't have them living near exploding reactors!
Midgar's in trouble, that's for sure.
Is there anything we can do to fix this?
Who knows?
Isn't it bedtime? Why is everyone outside?
Because something big happened. That's why!
Everything's gonna be okay...right?
Sure it is! As long as I'm around, you'll be fine!
These assholes need to shut the hell up.
Damn, I need a drink.
I'm bored outta my goddamn mind.
Know any good part-time gigs? Like, at all? I could really use the money, man.
If I did, I wouldn't be here with you.
Can't believe he backed out like that.
And this was his idea. Ugh.
What the...?
That's where I work.
No freakin' way.
Put that fire out, idiots!
I was there yesterday.
Oh no...
Glad I got today off...
Am I still gonna to have a job?
Guess I'll find out...
Did everyone get out in time?
Wow...
Wait, this is real? It's not a movie?
How long's it gonna keep burning?
They gonna turn the reactor off?
Why did people blow it up?
What'll happen to the city now?
Think I should go back to my hometown?
Shinra'll make everything okay again!
I just hope I still have a job tomorrow...
Whaddya know─that ain't half bad. I'll make a grease monkey outta you yet.
Thanks! I've always dreamed of opening up my own shop! So I can look after my parents, you know?
Well, a man can always dream, can't he?
I wanna drink with Tifa so bad!
Who wouldn't! She's a looker!
A bombshell even!
What if I use her meathead friend to get to her? Yeah?
He'd smash your face in if he ever found out.
Tonight's the night I finally go to a club!
Or, uh, maybe not.
How do I look?
Pretty amazing, right?
Haha!
Yeah!
Keep it up!
Don't be a wallflower.
The hell do you think you're looking at?
Get lost. You're creeping me out.
They're awful carefree, considering a reactor just exploded.
They've got some nerve, that's for sure.
When the mako reactor exploded, wow, did the ground shake! It was crazy!
data.speaker: Kyrie

data.text: I heard about that on the news.
Don't you have anything better to talk about?
Anyone hear about this? You know the expressway by the station in Sector 8? It collapsed during the explosion!
data.speaker: Kyrie

data.text: No way...
They sent in the military to help with the relief efforts, but it's supposedly not going very well. And even more stuff might collapse!
data.speaker: Kyrie

data.text: Holy shit!
I risked my neck to get this valuable information for you guys. So, that'll be three gil. Nothing's free, you know.
data.speaker: Kyrie

data.text: If Midgar loses power, aren't computers and traffic lights and all that going to shut down? That can't be good.
The economic losses would be staggering. A couple hundred trillion gil or more.
And that's nothing compared to the lives already lost. At least most people were sleeping at the time, so they went peacefully.
But that doesn't change the fact that Midgar has been thrown into a panic. We need to know what the administration plans to do about this, and now!
In other words, you could say the reactor bombing's actually the first step toward a new and improved Midgar.
You're saying it was a good thing!?
The ends justify the means.
I dunno about that.
One thing's clear: you gotta give whoever did it credit. I know I wouldn't have the balls to go at Shinra like that.
Hmmm...
Someone's gotta take 'em down a peg.
You don't actually support those terrorists, do you!?
Of course not.
Sectors 1 and 8 are in bad shape plateside. People there won't have enough food or supplies for long.
But we'll be fine...
Not when they start taking from us, we won't.
She's got a point there.
In times of trouble, people up top and down below gotta work together.
Talk about naive...
You know they'll just give everything to the plate and leave us to suffer.
I'm sorry...but how can anyone concentrate when a reactor's been bombed?
Can we run by the TVs? I want to check the news for a sec.
I explicitly told you not to go to Culvert Street or any nightclubs!
That doesn't mean you get to barge in and embarrass me in front of everyone!
Oh, you didn't need me to embarrass you. "Look at me. I'm so young and hip!"
How'd I do?
Screw you, old man! You'll never understand!
Please get up...
You can sleep when you're home.
No thanks...
Get. Up.
Why?
God, you're a pain.
Heh heh heh...
I've had enough.
Saw some guy from Wall Market was hitting on you earlier. How'd that go?
Not good at all.
Apparently he was fishing for info on our sector. Weird, right?
You're telling me.
Got my hands on some high-class ingredients the other day. Talking cream of the crop.
And we get the watered-down version?
You never know...
So, my friend just told me she's gonna start seeing someone from the plate.
'Cause she wants an asshole to treat her like a diseased rat?
I think you've had enough to drink.
Where do those hoity-toity dicks get off pissing on us hardworking, salt-of-the-earth types?
Ah, you get turned town for a job again?
Just because I live here doesn't mean I'm a bum!
I saw Loveless recently. Was standing room only, but still...
What!? How'd you get tickets!?
Through a friend. She's an up-and-coming actress of sorts.
Jessie?
Oh no, not her. She's from the same boarding house though.
So, how was Loveless? You gotta tell me.
I wanna say...it was totally revolutionary, yet somehow traditional at the same time. You'll just have to see it yourself.
And I so wanna!
I don't know what it is, but my life feels so empty.
If you're looking to fill the existential void, I know just the place.
Where?
Wall Market!
U-uh... Really?
Without a doubt.
Tifa brought a guy with her!?
See you at Seventh Heaven tomorrow, Tifa!
What!? Who's that with you!?
Wait, he's not your boyfriend, is he!?
Lemme guess: you've never been to the club behind Seventh Heaven.
Never had anyone to go with.
Well, then you're in luck: everyone knows me there, so I'm the perfect date. I'll give you a night you'll never forget.
Oh, you will, will you?
It seems the reactor really was bombed.
Does that mean...we're gonna go to war again?
Don't be silly.
Sure, we may be fine now, but what if they decide to bomb Reactors 6 and 7 as well?
I don't even wanna think about that.
We wouldn't have to if Shinra hurried up and caught them.
So, what do you think Wall Market's like?
I heard you can satisfy all your wildest desires in there!
Damn, I gotta go!
When I go to Wall Market, I'm totally getting some chocobo beans!
The heck is that!? Never heard of 'em.
I'd love to go there, too...
I am three sheets to the wind!
'Nother day in the bag! Woo-hoo!
Whoa...you look terrible, old man. What's wrong? The rat race got you down?
You can take a load off at my place...but not for free. I gotta make a living too, you know.
Me wanting to leave Midgar didn't go over so well.
You wanna leave?
I'm just tired of being on the bottom rung.
Be on the lookout for monsters.
See anything weird, tell us.
What a cool sword.
You've seen some shit, huh?
I'm so sick of living life in the gutter. I want out.
Yeah, well, it's not that easy. You gotta fight tooth and nail for it.
What I wouldn't give to be a cat. They can do whatever they want.
If they can do whatever they want, why do so many choose to hang around Wedge?
'Cause he feeds them?
I don't think I've ever seen Seventh Heaven close that early.
I know! All I wanted was to finish my show. How dare they kick us out.
Aw, don't take it personally. You heard how much Tifa apologized.
You know of a club called "The Leaf House"? I heard that Biggs has poured a lot of money into that place.
Club? Uh, the Leaf House is an orphanage.
It is?
Yeah. He donates to them because he grew up there.
I'm gonna try to find some live-in work on the plate tomorrow. Wish me luck.
Yeah, sure. Good luck...but don't get your hopes up.

Are you here to play too?
I like playing in the park. Do you?

You know, I'm not supposed to be here.
I'm sick, so I should be at home. But I sneak out at night a lot.
You don't have any friends? Yeah, me neither... You're just like me!

I know! We can be friends. Yay, a friend!
I'm real glad I decided to come.
Hey there. What can I do for you?
data.speaker: Item Store Owner

data.text: Hey, if it isn't Tifa!
You here for the filter?
That's that mercenary guy...
Doesn't look that strong...
Everyone and their mother knows the people who live there are bad news.
I know, but I can't resist a bad boy.
Well, as you now know, "bad boys" sometimes rack up mountains of debt.
It's true he borrowed money from a less-than-reputable source...
but he was telling me about this lucrative Wall Market job even someone like me can do!
And you believed him?

I remember something about being a "concubine"?
I should get the details sometime.
Is that who Wedge mentioned?
The merchant?
That sword's massive...
What does he sell again?
I hear you sell swords. Might wanna introduce yourself to the other merchants to get off on the right foot.
You know how turf can be a touchy subject and all.
Come on, you know you wanna.
Stop it. I can't.
Please? Just a few gil.
Nope. I'm not lending you squat.
Lemme take you somewhere nice, babe.
Huh? Aren't you broke?
Yeah, but you're not.
Oh, but I am. Lost it all on a bet.
Hah, that's my girl!
Compared to what it used to be, this place is paradise now.
That bad, huh?
Back when the watch didn't have much clout, it was a goddamn combat zone. A free-for-all.
You know, there's a hole in the break room roof. We should probably get that fixed.
Do mercenaries do roofs?
We gotta do something about the monsters on Scrap Boulevard.
I'll head on down there first thing tomorrow!
Not alone you won't!
You hear someone got rid of all the monsters on Scrap Boulevard?
No! That was supposed to be me!
Is that the, uh...the guy for hire?
Wait, I thought he was the watch's gofer.
No, he sells weapons.
There's our cleanup guy!
You've been kicking some serious monster ass.
We'd love to have you in the watch!
What?
Everyone here's so in awe of your skills...
they decided to emulate you...starting with your cool indifference.
That's the guy who ran the monsters off the boulevard.
Just look at that sword of his. It's so big!
Heard you cleaned up Scrap Boulevard.
Nice job, buddy!
You're our go-to monster slayer now.
Phew, I can finally sleep at night!
Wymer was singing your praises earlier. Said we didn't deserve someone of your caliber.
You're welcome any time!
Hey, merc. Good to see ya.
You're doing an amazing job.
I'm gonna miss work if I wait much longer.
Apparently all of the trains have stopped running.
They'd better not dock my pay for this...
Why the hell is the Sector 7 train stopped too?
Are you kidding me? Service is suspended!?
I really need to get to the plate. And soon.
I understand the Sector 1 and 8 trains being stopped, but 7!?
What makes them think they can shut down all the lines?
"All good things come to those who wait..."
I've gotta assume at least one train will come.
This is not good. I have work.
I don't have time for this.
Can you believe it? Some people asked HQ this morning to open this place up again.
Fools looking to make a quick gil poking around somewhere crawling with monsters.
That's salvagers for ya.
The things people do for money...
The graveyard's off-limits. Wouldn't want you to be attacked by monsters.
Can't let you pass until our investigation's over.
How do you not know the graveyard's closed off? The news is all over town.
I don't care how tough you are or how big your sword is. Beat it.
I assume you've heard about those people who went missing in the graveyard?
The neighborhood watch is blaming it on monsters, but they're flat-out wrong.
It was ghosts. There are eyewitness accounts of ghosts abducting some of the victims!
Really!?
Why in the world's our train stopped!? Shinra had better comp us our lost time.
Fat chance.
I'm gonna get something to eat.
My husband was in Sector 8 when the bombers struck, and he still hasn't come back yet...
I know it's scary, but he'll return once the trains start moving again.
What if he's cheating on me with some topside slut right now!?
Okay...did not expect that.
Why are all the train lines shut down? I thought only Sector 1 and 8 were hit.
Shinra could be trying to limit the bombers' movements. Make it harder for them to avoid the authorities.
What!? They're still at large!?
I'm gonna hunt down those criminals and bring 'em to justice, no matter what!
Mark my words, Avalanche! You'll pay for your crimes!
I really needed those hours today... Now my paycheck's gonna be short this time around.
You in debt?
Might as well be. This was the last month my landlord was willing to wait on my rent.
Thanks to Avalanche, I'm going to get evicted!
Apparently not even the station attendants know when the trains will start back up. Their guess is as good as ours.
Well, I hope our deal with the Sector 8 office doesn't fall through...
Well, worrying isn't gonna help. All we can do is wait patiently.
Why did it have to be the one day I have a deal to close?
Want me to pick out an apology gift?
Nothing you can get here will make up for this. Maybe something from Wall Market, but...
I'm sorry, but we've received no updates since we were told to suspend service this morning.
How will I get to work!?
You owe us!
I'm truly sorry, but all I can say is the whole of Shinra's railway division is working to rectify this issue.
So there's no chance the Sector 5 train will come!?
My superiors are aware of the issue...
Cut the shit!
I swear, I don't know anything more than you do! My apologies.
Limp-dicked pissant.
You know you want some of this, babe.
I do, but...
But what?
But...we're being watched.
Huh? I...I'm flattered you want to watch, but we're not into that kinda thing. Mind doing it somewhere else?
Wherever the hungry masses are, that's where I'll be!
Some might've lost their faith in mako energy, but I'll be damned if I let 'em lose their appetites!
If anyone's lost their faith in anything, it's me thinking you'll ever settle down and stop working.
Somebody's gotta be on standby for when the kid gets exhausted!
Black milly does not belong on a burger.
I'm never gonna get used to that flavor...
Here are the finest used goods the plate has to offer.
Hmmm... Not half bad.
These beauties just came in from the plate. Whaddya say?
I just can't decide...
I recommend that rug there. It's all you need to transform any room into the lap of luxury.
And it won't fall apart on me?

Its owner topside had it for twenty years.
Sure, it's got some stains and some loose threads, but that just adds to the character.
You look like you got topside connections. How 'bout hooking a guy up?
Boy, I'd love to work on the plate.
I can't believe they stopped the trains like that.
I, for one, am not surprised. The expressway did collapse in Sector 8.
I can't imagine the station's much better.
Yeah, but that's only one sector. Why shut down all the other trains? It doesn't make sense!
Think there'll be any emergency train service?
That's a funny question to ask. Why do you think we're all here?
Try another distro route?
They say it's smooth sailing once you're in with Sector 6.
They also say that once their dirt gets on your hands, it never comes off.
With no trains, I'm gonna run out of ingredients. I have a stockpile, but...
Yeah. I'm not exactly swimming in supplies myself.
How are we gonna manage if our suppliers can't come through?
I know someone in Sector 6. Maybe they can help.
Wall Market, huh? They've got some strange tastes over there. Not sure how much of their stuff would sell.
Hey, you wanna get pet, don'tcha? I know you do.
Come on, little guy, don't be scared. I won't bite.
You, my dear, deserve a topside wedding.
You mean it?
How could I not? I love you so, so much, my darling cutie-pie...
And I love you, my adorable honey-pumpkin.
For our honeymoon, we can savor the view from Shinra Tower.
Aw, how romantic!
When's the train gonna come?
Might as well sleep until it does.
I don't want trains to come. I want you here.
I know, but if I don't go to work, how will we eat? Where will we live?
We can pick up old parts and sell them. Just don't go. It's too scary.
We'd never make enough to get by if we did that.
Plus, the monsters we'd have to fight to get them are scarier than the plate.
This approval process for live-in jobs is killing me. I just want it to be over and done with.
Living topside as a first-class citizen...
Yeah, my life can only get better!
I've got it all planned out. I'm gonna tell everyone I'm from Junon or somewhere.
Ah, good idea. I wouldn't wanna deal with the stigma of being from the slums either.
I never knew this, but the food stalls here have made a name for themselves.
Yeah, I heard they even attract foodies from up on the plate.
Got anything that'll kill my sense of smell? The water in my apartment reeks of rotten eggs.
I've got just the thing. You'll never even know you had a nose.
If you were gonna cut in line...think twice.
The best drinks in town are right here.
My mattress is too hard. I can't sleep.
I just need to forget today happened...
Still no trains? I can't sleep for another night on that moldy excuse for a bed.
Neither can I. I was coughing and sneezing the entire night.
I don't even care if it's not Sector 8. I just want to go back up.
Agreed. The stench here is unbearable.
They found out who bombed the reactor. The newscaster said it was Avalanche.
First they bomb the reactor, then they shut down the train... What'll they think of next?
Sock the president right in the face?
You joke, but...
If you think about it, the reactors have to be shut down for the planet to survive.
And how do we survive after that?
With a planet to live on, we'll manage.
I've seen that poster. There's one just like it near my house.
Unless you want Public Security at your door, I'd take it down.
You're right, but...they're not wrong. Conservation and the planet are important too. I don't know...
Watch who you say that around.
I saw it first, got it!?
I'm gonna be so rich!
Get outta there!
We could probably use this if we clean the rust off.
Oh, this one too.
Guess we hit the jackpot today.
Hey, this one could be worth a lot.
Whatever it's worth, we're splitting it.
Yeah, yeah, I know!
Hey, the area around the old factory's off-limits.
If you wanna poke around, you'll have to wait till the blockade's lifted!
The factory's "open for business" again!
While it is okay to enter the factory now, you should still come prepared.
Make sure you're geared up before you go in.
Recently, a rather aggressive monster from the train graveyard took up residence nearby.
Everyone in the immediate area should exercise caution!
If you happen to spot any other strange creatures prowling the factory, the watch would like to know.
If the planet's a living being, we should be learning more about it.
Are you serious?
What? You think it's all a hoax or something?
I heard they still haven't managed to put out the reactor fire.
They say Avalanche is the one responsible.
With Reactor 1 out of commission, what'll happen to us?
I won't be able to sleep until they catch those assholes...
The bombing will likely impact us here more than people think.
If we can't get food and supplies from the plate anymore...
I was supposed to be working topside today, but not anymore.
Looks like I'm not the only one who got the day off today.
I heard it was Avalanche who bombed the reactor...
I've heard of them... They hate everything Shinra stands for or whatever, right?
I wonder if everyone in Sector 8 is okay.
I hope the people who died were able to return to the planet.
It might be a good idea to stock up on food before it's all gone.
What canned goods won't I get sick of?
It's so lively today. I suppose this is what it's like when no one can get up to the plate.
Everyone seems so calm and composed...
You never know─the Sector 8 platies might have to take refuge here.
If that happens, I'm not sure we'd all be able to get along.
I think we all know that most topsiders look down their noses at us.
I never got that impression when I worked up there.
Well, my friend who moved up there said everyone was rude to her.
Lot more people than usual.
Yeah, and they're all a bundle of nerves.
You can thank the trains for that.
I feel real sorry for all the people who can't get to work up top.
Me too. I'd hate to have my pay docked for that.
It's the worst.
My wife's worried that if this goes on much longer, we're gonna have some tough decisions to make.
Think we could get some money if we strip this thing for parts?
Looks damn near rusted through to me.
I'm game as long as it buys us a round.
Have you ever tried saving money?
Yeah, have you ever heard the phrase "living hand to mouth"?
Our daughter deserves to go to a good school topside.
It's not that simple. Plus, there's no guarantee it'll help her get a high-paying job.
Yeah! And I don't even like studying!
Maybe we never should have moved after all...
This town just seemed so full of opportunity when we first came...
I don't know. I like it here. It's nice.
Pleeease give me a job!
Have you asked your parents?
I don't have any!
Come on, give me a...trial run? Do your worst!
Fine then. Go search the scrap heaps and bring me back a hundred nails and a hundred screws.
If I bring them all back, you'll give me a job?
I'll think about it.
"Think about it"!? Lame.
The bombing of Mako Reactor 1...
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: has been confirmed as an attack carried out by the eco-terrorist organization known as Avalanche.
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: The terrorists have a history...
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: of targeting Shinra facilities and employees, and they have declared themselves opposed to the company's agenda.
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: Mayor Domino and President Shinra decried...
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: this heinous assault on our society and shared values...
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: as well as promised us that they would do everything in their power to restore peace and order to our fair city.
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: So this is all Avalanche's fault!?
They still haven't put all the fires out?
Apparently, the Sector 8 expressway collapsed.
They were saying there's parts of Sectors 1 and 8 that still don't have power.
Well, at least we know who to blame.
If Avalanche did it, they had to have done it for the sake of the planet...right?
You can't hide forever, Avalanche! You're going down!
So Avalanche did all these bad things?
Those bikes are reserved for someone tonight─someone important─so make sure it's in top condition. Got it?
Y-yes, sir!
Who's gonna ride 'em?
A husky guy and a lean guy, but it doesn't matter. All you need to know is they both give us a lot of business.
My sister on the plate came down to visit me, and she looked like a completely different person!
I wish I could live topside like her.
It's so boring around here during the day...
Night can't come fast enough...
Wish I had some way to pass the time...
I swear, there's jack all to do.
S'pose I could start looking for a part-time gig or whatever...
Dancing's all I've got these days...
You a Seventh Heaven regular?
You don't look the type.
C'mon, gotta be something in here to eat...
...Or not. Nothing but trash...
Shops on Culvert Street stock goods you won't find in more reputable establishments.
Never ask folks about their suppliers. They don't take kindly to questions.
Got the latest and greatest Shinra brand goods for you right here. Stuff nobody's even selling yet.
Serial numbers filed off and everything for your peace of mind.
Hey, this look like a bloodstain to you?
Shit. That always there? Huh, dunno how we missed it during the inspection.
Better not make it a habit or we'll lose out.
I'll have a little chat with my man.
A kettle?
Solid gold, ornamental. Rich people have the weirdest tastes.
Could say the same about the guy who nicked it.
Not that you or me'd know anything about that. Don't wanna give people the wrong idea, feel me?
Yeah, true that.
The vacant lot up ahead is overrun with wild beasts. Best steer clear unless you're looking for trouble─
data.speaker: Undercity Resident

data.text: Even if you are, be careful.
data.speaker: Undercity Resident

data.text: Some folks use the lot for meet-ups.
data.speaker: Undercity Resident

data.text: Seedy types who like their privacy and don't take kindly to interruptions.
data.speaker: Undercity Resident

data.text: Seems a whole bunch of giant rats've been congregating in the vacant lot lately.
data.speaker: Undercity Resident

data.text: Nonstop squeaking's driving me insane.
data.speaker: Undercity Resident

data.text: The leader of the rat pack is the worst of 'em all. The loudest, most obnoxious squeaking...
data.speaker: Undercity Resident

data.text: Johnny liked to mimic it until we told him to cut that shit out.
data.speaker: Undercity Resident

data.text: I'm guessing you're the merc who dealt with those damn rats?
data.speaker: Undercity Resident

data.text: That wasn't me who put in the request, but as a resident of Culvert Street, I appreciate what you did.
data.speaker: Undercity Resident

data.text: You ever take a...stroll down Culvert Street?
Of course not! Full of thugs and creeps, isn't it?
Naw, just some sketchy stores. Not the least bit curious?
Uhh... I dunno if that's my thing...
You know, a lotta folks say the shops on Culvert Street sell stuff you can't find anywhere else.
Like what?
No idea, but I'm dying to find out!
Everyone's worried they're gonna run out of money soon.
It's a sad day when people care more about what's in their wallet than what's happening to the planet.
There are so many people who just don't get that the planet is a living thing.
'Cause Shinra's brainwashed 'em.
Tifa! Mind if I stop by later?
You gonna bless us with your cooking tonight?
When's the bar open for business? I'm dying of thirst.
So...Seventh Heaven's gonna be open tonight, yeah?
I've got you now! SOLDIER strike!
I'm not a sheep!
Stupid kid's games are stupid!
What's the source of all life?
The lifestream, right!?
What's a lifestream?
Don't rush it and drop your tools!
Take your time now, okay?
Don't take your eyes off it!
Damn trainees need to focus.
Can we get one of those too?
Not unless it's on the list.
Now where are the lightbulbs...
Let's get the biggest one!
No, we're gonna get the "energy efficient" one like we were told.
I want that one.
No, it'll show dirt too easily.
Mom, the stores here are gross.
Don't say that! It's very rude.
It's not bad...but it's not what the people on TV are wearing.
You don't need what the people on TV are wearing─you need affordable clothes like what they have here.
They may be used, but they look like new! Check out our latest arrivals!
Loose threads? Rips and tears? No problem! We'll fix them for a song!
You look like you could use a new outfit. How about it?
Put on anything here and you'll be transformed into a fashionable topsider!
You there, young man. I bet a brighter ensemble would brighten your mood!
Don't you just love this material? It's so sleek and smooth!
It's ameeezing!
We're gonna find the best bargains yet!
We're gonna be Midgar's next trendsetters!
Look out, world! Our style is unstoppable!
Which is better?
Everything looks great on you!
You're not making this easy.
Which one are you thinking?
Oh the first one, without a doubt.
I'll take both!
Oh, Tifa! I've got a new top with your name on it!
Or I could put you in a fabulous new ensemble that would get everyone talking!
There's this one dude in the watch who's like a genius cat whisperer, I hear.
Wish I could conversate with the little guys.
Not a lot of options when it comes to food these days. Other shelves were looking pretty bare too.
Everybody's feeling the effects of the bombing.
Might be time to start stocking up.
Keep it quiet if you do. We don't want trouble.
Their cuteness moves me to tears! But their fur makes my nose run. But it's a small price to pay!
Cat allergy, huh? Should probably keep your distance.
It just me or there more strays around here these days?
Definitely more of them hassling me for food.
These shipments from Sectors 1 and 8 aren't nearly enough to keep us afloat.
Let's see if we can cut a deal with one of the shops in Sector 3. If not, can always ask Shinra...
They won't do us any favors.
People are counting on us. If we have to close up shop...
I know...
Stamp's the one... Who'll get the job done...
The bravest dog of all... He's there when you...something...something...
The new Loveless musical was absolutely brilliant!
So, was this different from the annual production?
The finale's a touch different, but...if you see it for yourself, you'll understand!
If I can get a ticket, that is.
A friend of mine's an aspiring actor.
If you're interested in seeing Loveless, I could ask her to help get you a ticket!
They expensive?
You could probably afford a standing ticket in the grand circle...
Some creepy dude who hit on me was asking all kinds of strange questions about Seventh Heaven.
About Barret and the other members of his crew.
You talking about the creepy dude out of Wall Market?
You know him?
"Girl...your eyes are more dazzling than the neon lights of the Honeybee Inn."
He gave you that line too huh?
"How's about you and me get a room and play pin the tail feather on the chocobo?"
Is that like the new favorite pickup line down in Wall Market?
Who the hell knows.
Another day I can't work 'cause I can't get plateside. I'm getting sick of this...
Probably so crowded 'cause everyone else is stuck down here.
Guess I'll go check later if the trains have started back up or not.
Be real nice if Avalanche reimbursed me for the wages I lost 'cause of their bullshit.
Somebody oughta do something...
Chili beans, get your chili beans! A Sector 7 favorite! How 'bout it?
Y'all won't find better beans this side of the plate!
Here's to drinking all day long!
To sin and debauchery!
Wife's probably gonna give me shit.
Blame it on the bomb! Ain't your fault!
You got any chili beans?
Stall across the way does. Hmm... Platie, am I right?
Huh?
A local boy would know what a stall's selling just by the look of it. That's all.
So what kinda food are you selling?
The dirt cheap kind. Far from the best, but my regulars only care about the price.
My husband decided to go to the station and see if it had gotten any better.
The bombing's made such a mess of everything.
Apparently it was done by a terrorist group called Avalanche.
This isn't the first time they've caused trouble. I've seen them on the news before.
Nothing to report. Maintaining surveillance. Ohhh, being a spy is so cool!
Holding position until nightfall! Will report any developments immediately if observed!
So they blew up a reactor so they could save the planet? More like they want us to give up our way of life.
There'll be no way of life for anyone if we kill the planet.
So the environmentalists say.
But I say people and their jobs and their families have to come first─otherwise, what's the point?
What's gonna happen to Midgar?
It was just one reactor, dear. Everything's gonna be fine.
Not if Avalanche has anything to say about it.
Shinra can't afford to let such a horrible act of terrorism go unanswered.
This disaster's cost a lot of folks their livelihoods. Shinra needs to do something to show the people they're on their side.
At the end of the day, it's just a company. They're not on anyone's side but their own.
If this struggle with Avalanche turns into all-out war...
I'm staying here till the bitter end.
Not me. I'd go back home. Mako's nice and all, but life here isn't all sunshine and rainbows.
Until they get Reactor 1 back up and running, the factory's gonna stay shut down.
No way we can afford the rent on our place. I'll start looking for a new one...
Back to living in a dump somewhere.
The watch is saying they're gonna step up their game.
How? Ain't they shorthanded?
Absolutely, but with the bombing and all, they're trying extra hard to recruit more people.
Gotta admit, the watch is a lot more impressive than it was a couple years back.
Prolly 'cause of those vets who joined up after the cease-fire with Wutai.
Maybe. But didn't a bunch of them eventually quit, saying they were done with all the fighting?
Strong-er! Fast-er! Cooler!
Glor-i-ous! Glist-ening! Muscles!
You can...do it! Push it...to the limit!
After a thousand...you'll be ready...to hit up Jessie!
You got this... You got this...!
Still got some left...in the tank!
Why bother putting them outside if they're gonna get dirty again...?
Wish I could dry my clothes in cleaner air...
Been some talk about a girl who went to Wall Market and never came home.
Yeah, I heard it too...but we've got no authority down there.
Yeah...
Go find somewhere else to hang out.
Call us if you see trouble.
Ain't no monsters here. Ain't no monsters here...
Fear is in the mind. Fear is in the mind...
Gotta stay focused. Even on break.
It's the little noises that worry me.
Don't try anything funny or you'll get it.
The kids seem to think you're pretty cool.
Dooot doot dot dot dooot... Go go Staaamp... Dooot doot dot dot dooot...
They call him Stamp 'cause he... Dooot doot dot dot dooot... Does really cool stuff I can't remember...
Hey Tifa, baby!
I'll see you at the bar later!
That the childhood friend from out of town I heard about?
That lucky son of a bitch grew up with her? Screw him...
You were supposed to be working in Sector 8 yesterday!
You told me you had an interview in Sector 1!
I can't believe you were on a date in Sector 4!
You took a girl out to Wall Market on a birthday date!
Still... I'm glad you're okay.
I gotta admit, I was pretty worried about you too...
But we gotta talk about the cheating!
Damn right we do!
Guy who lives over there's got a real hard-on for cleanliness.
Chewed this one out once before. He was really upset about the trash smell.
That's where the watch guy Biggs lives, right? Heard he's like a major neat freak.
If only he'd clean my place...
...Take a picture, why don'tcha?
You got something to say?
Nobody's here...
Meooow... Meooow!
Not gonna let you sleep a wink tonight!
Your snoring keeps me up every night!
Thinking I might join in one of those Wall Market games. Make us a fortune.
Don't. You'll get yourself killed.
Or die trying, baby─anything for you.
Yes... Yes! Just like that!
Bam!
Just like...this!
Yeah... Yeah!
I met this girl from Sector 5 the other day. She was here to see that scrap dealer over there.
What was she like?
Super cool.
I swear, all the plateside jobs are one-off gigs. No matter how hard I work, I've still gotta hustle nonstop.
One-off or not, the pay's still dogshit, though.
If they know you're from down here, they're gonna try to screw you over regardless.
Thought I'd become a jillionaire coming to Midgar and working my ass off.
I might not be rich, but I do enjoy life here more than I did back in Junon.
I still can't believe that nice young girl who lived next door ran off in the night!
Probably with that punk boyfriend of hers.
She even stuck a note on the door saying "Don't come looking for me"!
But didn't she send money back home on the regular?
And then she gets into one of those flashy Wall Market carriages...
What a waste.
Huh? You want a piece of me?
Personal space, man─respect it.
That Johnny...
What's he done this time?
There's nothing we can do now...
Stay strong, Johnny boy.
So Shinra's here?
That's odd.
Does the watch know about this?
What's this gonna mean for us?
Gotta be the reactor...
He's in deep shit.
Ain't no time to be mouthing off to security.
Classic Johnny, for sure.
When will he learn?
He needs to get his act together.
He's in Shinra's hands now...
I feel bad for him.
Was he involved in the bombing?
We might as well forget about him...
This isn't gonna come back on the rest of us, is it?
He could go to jail.
What in the...?
Why's Shinra here?
At it again? For heaven's sake...
Why would you provoke Shinra like that?
I hope he's okay.
Can't help but be worried.
He's a good kid at heart.
Will he be alright?
He's got balls, screwing with Public Security.
I told him to keep his head down.
The hell went down at Johnny's?
I'd love to help, but you know...
He piss someone off again?
Crazy...
What'd that idiot do now?
Did he go overboard again?
He's in for it, huh?
Someone should break him out or something...
I know he can be a pain, but Johnny isn't a bad guy.
The kid just needs to learn when to stop talking big...or at all.
They come in and act like they own the place.
All because Shinra signs their checks.
You have any idea what happened to Johnny?
I never seen him so scared.
He really skipping town?
I guess Shinra gave him an ultimatum.
What'd they do to him?
Why would he wanna just up and leave?
Weird how he didn't have a scratch on him.
There's no way he'll actually leave.
In a place this dark and depressing...
you need someone who can lighten the mood─someone bright and cheerful like Johnny.
Hope he was joking about leaving.
He said he was leaving town. Does this mean we'll never see him again?
You know Johnny. He's just exaggerating! He'll be back before you know it.
I mean, he wouldn't just up and leave, would he?
What's gotten into Johnny?
What would make him wanna leave?
What did Shinra do to him?
On the plus side, he wasn't hurt.
Johnny was in and out in a flash.
Shinra must have threatened his life or something.
I saw Johnny fly out of his place like a rocket.
I wonder what's going on.
My boy up and declared he was leaving town to go on a journey.
data.speaker: Johnny's Father

data.text: We only live once. I say while he's young, he should follow his heart.
data.speaker: Johnny's Father

data.text: Even if it means defying the Man. Playing by the rules only gets you so far.
data.speaker: Johnny's Father

data.text: Oh. I don't think I've had a chance to introduce myself yet. I'm Johnny's father.
data.speaker: Johnny's Father

data.text: I'm sure you're terribly worried about him too─aren't you, Tifa?
data.speaker: Johnny's Father

data.text: That's my boy. I'll have to remember to tell him that when he finally comes back home.
data.speaker: Johnny's Father

data.text: My son suddenly told us that he was going to leave town!
data.speaker: Johnny's Mother

data.text: Oh tell me it isn't true! He can't survive out there on his own!
data.speaker: Johnny's Mother

data.text: He's a headstrong boy, so once he puts his mind to something, he always follows through.
data.speaker: Johnny's Mother

data.text: For better or worse, I suppose...
data.speaker: Johnny's Mother

data.text: I know you! You're that...what was it?
So...you're the mercenary?
Hey, if you're a hired hand, fix my house for me.
Best of luck to you, kid.
Good luck with the new business!
Can I hire you to babysit my kid sometime?
Aha, the man with the strange job!
Does anyone really need to hire a killer?
If there's nothing you can't do, you can fix my plumbing, right?
I wish you luck in your endeavors.
Sorry...what exactly is it that you do again?
So you're like an assassin?
I get it now. You're kind of like an exterminator.
People tell me you're pretty strong.
Thanks a bunch for keeping our streets safe!
I heard you're making money hand over fist. I'm jealous.
If it isn't the merc puttin' in work!
Heard good things aboutcha.
Everyone's talking about you!
You make good money as a merc?
You're helping out the watch, huh? Good on you.
There anything he'll refuse to do?
He's not a gofer, you know.
People are saying good things about you, merc.
Why, if it isn't the mercenary of the hour!
There any fiend you can't kill?
So how's everything going, sir?
You've built quite the reputation, you know.
You're the boy who fights for money.
I might need your help one day.
You must be strong if you fight a lot.
Do you think you're stronger than the people in the neighborhood watch?
I can sleep easy knowing you're around.
Is it true that you'll take on any monster?
I should try my hand at this mercenary thing.
I'll be sure to call if I need you.
The one-and-only merc of the slums!
I don't know what we'd do without you.
Everybody's singing your praises!
I love what you're doing for the town, merc!
Thanks to you, this town's never been safer!
Gotta say: you're awesome!
It's the mercenary! Yay!
You make the sector a better place.
Thanks. We appreciate all you've done for us.
You've got my vote of confidence!
We truly owe you a debt of gratitude.
No one down here fights like you!
The merc really knows how to fight with style!
He's so dreamy...
Are you that mercenary everyone's talking about?
I wish I had your strength and confidence.
You have made all of our lives a little bit brighter.
I can tell you're a serious guy. Everyone who does good work is.
We all thank you from the bottom of our hearts.
You've done so much for our community.
How do I become a merc like you?
You're so cool.
It's the fighter guy!
Can we play together sometime, mister fighter guy?
So he's the rat slayer...
News this good just has to lift the owner's spirits.
Those disgusting vermin deserved what they got.
Glad we no longer have a rat problem.
You're a wonderful exterminator!
Good riddance to those rodents...
You know, the item store's fallen on hard times...
It's so bad, they might have to close up shop...
Heard you killed those pests.
Thanks. I'm sure he appreciates it.
Oh, hey. Thanks for helping out a fellow entrepreneur.
Word is you got rid of our oversized rat problem.
You totally saved that man's business.
Are they actually letting people in there now?
He's lived up to Jessie's hype, for sure.
Thanks to those damn monsters, we can't salvage nothing anymore!
The factory's full of monsters now.
First the train graveyard, now this... Someone needs to tell the watch to do their job!
The watch supposedly hired a professional mercenary to help 'em!
We can go scavenging again!
There can't be too much left, but it's better than nothing! I'll check it out.
We can't thank you enough, merc!
If there are monsters in the old factory, they could wander this way anytime.
We should be okay if the watch does their job, but you never know with them.
That mercenary killed all the fiends that had settled in the abandoned buildings!
We're good to go!
Great! We can finally work in peace.
Some rabid dog is prowling the boulevard.
Thank you. That hound had us scared half to death.
I'm not going anywhere near that mongrel.
It was just a little too much for me to handle...
Where do you think the damn thing came from anyway?
Looks like Wymer was right about you.
Is there anyone who can chase off that bloodthirsty cur?
Great job. You were our only hope against that beast.
That isn't any old mutt. It's a Shinra attack dog.
Not even a military attack dog is a match for our mercenary, huh!?
We need to think of a way we can get rid of it.
We should increase security to keep that vicious beast away from our homes.
Thanks for dealing with that filthy animal!
You're my kind of Public Security.
It took some real skill to get rid of that beast.
How about joining the watch? We could use a guy like you.
Did you really take care of that attack dog?
We're always looking for a man who knows how to swing his sword.
That flying thing didn't scare you?
You're a real one-man army!
The way Gwen talks about you, you're the best thing since mako.
Gwen was completely gushing over you earlier.
Good job ridding us of that pest.
You're much more reliable than Shinra.
The part I'm looking for has to be somewhere in the train graveyard, I know it.
Sneak in and the watch'll be mad at you.
I'm so scared.
I always forget killing drakes is an option when I'm in the train graveyard. Never felt the need though.
They don't attack!?
Oh, they do! All the time! But with legs this fast, who needs weapons?
...Just let me hire the mercenary instead. For both our sakes.
There are monsters on the plate too, right?
Nope.
That's not fair!
Come here, kitty kitty kitty...
I've seen that cat around here before.
The pads of cat paws are just irresistably squishy. I can't help but squeeze them over and over and over.
Ever squeezed a cat's paws before? It's great therapy. They're so cushiony and spongy...
I like cats a lot, but...too bad my allergies don't let me keep any.
Cats are so soft and furry and squishy, and the way they melt into whatever they're laying on...it just makes my heart melt too, you know?
Just looking at a well-groomed cat is enough to relieve my stress.
I think I might have seen that cat at the children's center.
I've figured out that the way to a cat's heart is through its stomach.
Come out, come out wherever you are, kitty cat.
What I wouldn't give to pet a cat right now.
My dream is to fall asleep every night in a bed covered with cats.
There are certain cats that are just gorgeous, you know?
That white one's one of the prettiest cats I've seen.
I simply cannot stand cats. I'm a dog person through and through.
My hatred developed when a cat scratched me as a child. Stared at me with the eyes of a born killer the whole time, too.
Betty's cats are gone and now she's sad.
M-maybe they're still around. You never know.
I looked yesterday, but I didn't find any.
Betty said she got her cats back. Some stupid "mercenary" or something found them, I guess.
Awww, mad the mercenary guy found them and not you?
Shut up!
Thank you for getting Betty's cats back. It really means a lot to her.
Now she gets to hear their cute voices all day. "Meow."
You have to come eventually, right? ...Ugh, it feels like it's been forever.
I believe in you, little guy. Don't disappoint me... Please.
Do you think the train graveyard really could be haunted? It'd be so cool if those rumors were true!
People do say they've seen ghosts there...
The MHS131's way better than any other train.
Even though it doesn't tilt as much as previous models, the 131 is both faster and more stable than the others.
I can't believe it can take a curve like that at those speeds.
Yeah, but I kinda like how the 102 rocks back and forth a little bit.
Still, compared to the 97, the 131's mako-based dampening system is a major improvement.
With all that swaying, it must've been terrible for people to go topside.
Awww, I really, really, really wanna ride the 97 at least once in my life. You can only get that feeling with older absorbers.
Too bad we'll never get the chance. But we can always dream.
Now that I think of it, they upgraded the emergency braking system a while ago, didn't they?
They did. The deceleration rate's better than ever...supposedly. Haven't heard of anyone needing to use them.
Yeah, but it'd be super cool, huh? Sparks flying everywhere like "pew pew pew"!
Hello there! You must be that friend of Tifa's I've heard so much about. The mercenary?
data.speaker: Johnny's Father

data.text: I've got fingers in a few pies myself. Worked with a lot of businesses─even Seventh Heaven on occasion.
data.speaker: Johnny's Father

data.text: What I'm saying is, you and me, we're not so different─and certainly not complete strangers.
data.speaker: Johnny's Father

data.text: In fact, I want you to think of me as family. You know, an uncle or maybe a distant relative.
data.speaker: Johnny's Father

data.text: Oh, while I have you here, you wouldn't happen to be interested in grappling guns, would you? Great for getting up or down in a jiffy!
data.speaker: Johnny's Father

data.text: I ordered some for a client, but I accidentally added a zero, and now I have a ton to spare.
data.speaker: Johnny's Father

data.text: Was thinking of setting up an attraction where you jump from the top of the Shinra building. You know, for the adrenaline junkies.
data.speaker: Johnny's Father

data.text: But the fellas at Shinra didn't think it was such a great idea.
data.speaker: Johnny's Father

data.text: Hey, merc. What's with the glum face? You know, you oughta meet my son, Johnny. He'll turn that frown upside down.
data.speaker: Johnny's Father

data.text: He's got a big ol' heart, and a real way with people. Can't help but cheer 'em up.
data.speaker: Johnny's Father

data.text: Or, maybe that's just how I see him because he's my son.
data.speaker: Johnny's Father

data.text: You were right, boss. It was those Avalanche terrorists that bombed the reactor.
data.speaker: Shinra Employee

data.text: We won't let them beat us─not ever!
data.speaker: Shinra Employee

data.text: Right! Once the trains are running, we'll head to the office and do whatever we can to help!
data.speaker: Shinra Middle Manager

data.text: That's how we can fight back against terrorism!
data.speaker: Shinra Middle Manager

data.text: It's times like this that remind you how inconvenient life is down here. Man, if I could only live topside.
data.speaker: Shinra Employee

data.text: That's never gonna happen on my salary, though.
data.speaker: Shinra Employee

data.text: Don't say that. I know where you're coming from, but it's about more than our personal comfort.
data.speaker: Shinra Middle Manager

data.text: Shinra enriches everyone's lives with mako energy. You should focus on all the good you're doing for the world.
data.speaker: Shinra Middle Manager

data.text: I know, you're right, but...
data.speaker: Shinra Employee

data.text: That said, the higher I climb, the more zeroes you two are gonna see in your paychecks.
data.speaker: Shinra Middle Manager

data.text: Now that's what I'm talking about!
data.speaker: Shinra Employee

data.text: Looking forward to it!
data.speaker: Shinra Employee

data.text: They might think they're saving the planet or whatever, but all they're doing is killing Midgar!
Yeah, I know this bombing screwed me over something fierce.
What'd he do?
I feel bad for him.
He'll be fiiine.
Is he with them?
That's that mercenary...!
Call the watch.
They gonna fight?
Or they gonna recruit him?
This oughta be good.
Should I get the watch?
What? How're you alive?
Just who were those thugs anyway?
You rarely see guys like that, even here.
They the guys from six?
I've seen them around here a few times before.
Something went down.
You're still in one piece!
Who were those people, anyway?
Saw some real weirdos earlier.
Pretty sure those freaks have been here before.
Hey!
What─
Hey!
Ah!
I'm so sorry!
Don't overdo it.
Their boss is a dangerous man.
Not bad, merc. We owe ya.
There might be more on the way though, so watch your back.
Merc, you did good.
I won't ask what happened. You don't stay alive here by being nosy.
This here street behind me is Scrap Boulevard. It's crawling with monsters...
but the watch makes sure they don't get out.
If you don't wanna get hurt, keep your distance.
Good luck, Tifa! And be careful!
If any harm comes to her...
Doesn't look like a merc...
Let's see what he's made of...
Don't screw this up.
Keep up the good work, Tifa!
What an asshole...
I guess he's got his uses...
Stay alert now!
Don't get yourself hurt.
Now I know we'll be safe.
Goodbye, monsters.
Hey there!
Wipe 'em all out for us!
Get rid of every last one!
Hey, you just opened up shop in the area, didn't you?
You're the aspiring odd-jobber, right? I'll be in touch!
Hey, it's that guy who'll do anything you ask.
We won't be getting any more shipments until the trains start again.
Hopefully we'll get an update on the situation soon, but...
Best-case scenario, our supply lasts through the day after tomorrow.
People are beginning to stock up.
Probably realized that the bombings are gonna start messing with everyone's business down here.
Better think about putting limits on how much food a single customer can buy, otherwise it might get ugly...
Thinking I might have dinner at Seventh Heaven tonight...
I've chatted with that Barret guy a few times. Looks like a real hard-ass, but he's actually pretty chill.
There's no better way to unwind after a hard day's work than a drink at Seventh Heaven.
Tifa's got a knack for serving the perfect drink. Something hard, but clean and crisp.
Johnny's not a bad guy, but he has a pretty big mouth that he doesn't know when to keep shut.
Gotta love him for who he is.
I know...
So I was at the Honeybee Inn and I met this incredible girl! The woman of my dreams!
I don't know how much I've spent on her but I'm telling you, she's worth all the gil and then some!
She sure sounds like it!
I mean hey─what's money good for if not to spend on a pretty face? Know what I'm sayin'?
All the items you could want, straight from the plate!
No matter your needs or your budget, our wide selection of items is guaranteed to satisfy!
You a lover? You a fighter? No worries! We've got anything and everything you could possibly be looking for!
Thanks to the awesome new merc in town, everyone's favorite item shop is better than ever!
Don't be a stranger─drop on by your neighborhood item shop and check out our new expanded lineup!
Mmm, looking good...
Quality product makes a huge difference...
Just...like...that...
Just imagine if rich people start thinking it's safer down here than on the plate.
Enough of them move down here, life's bound to change for the better, no?
Keep dreaming, buddy.
Can't help but take a little pleasure in their panic.
More than a little.
Was gonna jump on that empty room at Stargazer Heights, but someone beat me to it.
Missed out on my chance to live next door to Tifa.
There's this one weirdo who lives there, too.
That landlady, Marle─she's always looking out for the neighborhood girls.
Was thinking I might chat up Marle myself. She knows a lot about life and love, and I sure could use some advice!
Everyone I know said they felt a lot better after talking to Marle about their problems.
If the trains don't start moving again, we're not gonna have enough food and other goods to go around. Could get ugly.
The watch is here to keep the peace. If anything happens, we'll step in immediately.
Folks who work topside are losing pay by the day. Lotta anger right now...
We're doing our best to keep a lid on things. Increasing patrols and recruiting more.
Even our facilities are starting to look a little run-down, don't you think?
Everybody does, but we keep putting off maintenance.
Someone looks like they're having a bad day. Try getting more sleep─that's the best cure-all down here!
Hold on─don't tell me you're making that face 'cause you think it looks cool, are you?
We're helping the watch keep watch!
If monsters come into town, we'll be the first to warn everybody!
I wonder... Think there's any way they can make our guns a little bit lighter?
Could always ask the arms dealer's dad about it.
I could go for a big-ass sword...
Something like the merc's?
Tell me that shit ain't cool.
No better way to keep you and your family safe than with a weapon of your own! Come and check out our selection!
Speak with our friendly staff to find the perfect weapon for you and your needs!
Want a big-ass sword like a certain badass merc's? We can hook you up!
Seen the merc with the biggest sword in town? You can own one just like his─while supplies last!
Come and check out the official weapons supplier for the number one merc in town!
Biggs is teaching me self-defense techniques.
I wonder if he's coming home soon.
Is it just me or are there more cats hanging around that vacant lot lately?
I think they're coming from the children's center.
Hey, Miss Lockhart, who's that guy you're with?
What's the big sword for?
Next item on the Friends of Freshness agenda: the ongoing sewage problem.
Can we expect Shinra to perform any maintenance?
The sewer system below the slums is essentially a maze of giant rusted pipes.
Any sort of maintenance would be a massive undertaking.
I've been told the sewage smell's gotten much worse near the cat cabaret.
Pipe nearby must've burst is the theory, but no one's worked up the nerve to check.
Dunno what everyone's so afraid of...
One two─
Ready?
One...two...shoot!
One...two...shoot!
Gotcha!
Aw man!
Aw, you got lucky!
Yes!
Whoever loses more has to clean the other's room!
Huh!? I thought we weren't keeping score!
Lots of girls who live here have the potential to become big, big stars!
One day I'll turn on the TV and see Jessie and all the others! It's gonna be great!
Gonna have to save up for the wedding.
How much we need to buy a house on the plate?
I told Dad we're getting married and moving topside, but he just laughed.
Why'd you tell him about our secret plan!?
I dunno...
Nothing worth a damn...
I can't flip this.
Just need enough to make a few bets in Wall Market...
Got a solid system but no gil to get myself started...
One of the Étoile girls who got cast in a Sector 8 production sent me tickets to her next performance!
That's so cool! But, uh, it wasn't canceled 'cause of the bombing or anything?
I don't think so?
The theater's pretty far from the reactor, and she told me it was still on when I asked.
Shake! Can't you learn?
You have to treat them with kindness and respect! Were you even listening to Wedge?
Hi, kitty! Wanna be my friend?
Me and my partner in Sector 5've been talking about adoption lately. We're seriously considering it.
Taking in an orphan?
We get it, you know. We both lost our parents in the war. These kids deserve better.
Can you even afford to raise a child?
Just got a new job at a shop in Sector 7. Owner's a fellow war orphan. He wanted to help too.
Families all over got torn apart, didn't they? And for what...?
Pink...? No, definitely white! Or...maybe red...?
Black's what you want, trust me. It's magic─hides all the stains.
Well, if it isn't Tifa!
...And that's the friend from back home?
Aw, why didn't I get to grow up with a hot guy?
Introduce us properly sometime.
If none of the trains are running, I assume the factories in Sectors 1 and 8 got hit too.
I figured I should at least stock up on food for my kids before there's nothing left.
Food's not the only thing we'll need.
I gotta buy toilet paper quick!
When I went to the store, the shelves were already almost empty. Everyone had the same idea.
That was fast!
Stores are rationing their stock.
As an excuse to hike their prices...
You won't get the best of me!
You can do it!
Time to strut your stuff!
Yes, enjoy yourselves.
It's like they don't even care a reactor blew up.
Hope he's okay. Last I knew, he was posted in Reactor 1. Haven't heard from him since it blew.
Burning the midnight oil, are we?
Keep your head on a swivel out there, merc.
Avalanche're the bad guys, right?
Whatever happens, Shinra will protect us.
I stayed up all night thinking about the reactor bombing.
Scares me to death thinking there might be more to come.
If mako's bad for the planet...
Then that means us folks using it are ruining the world...
We can't take everything Shinra says as truth. They're not always right.
It might just be worth hearing what Avalanche has to say...
I don't want to, but I can't help picturing what would happen if they attacked the Sector 7 or 8 reactors.
But Avalanche'd never do anything to hurt the slums, would they?
Shinra needs to stop pussyfooting around and take 'em all out.
I'll never forgive those terrorists for what they've done to us.
From what I heard, the mako reactors are really bad for the planet.
Honestly, I wouldn't've ever thought about it if it wasn't for the attack.
So long as the children're safe, Avalanche can do whatever they like.
No matter what the future holds, Shinra will be there for us.
The real question is when the trains'll start running again. If they're still shut down come tomorrow...
I can't lose out on another paycheck.
What the hell did Avalanche think was gonna happen?
But...you know, if the planet dies, then that's it for all of us.
At this rate, we're dead long before the planet.
You gotta love a quiet night...
Yeah, quiet till the next bomb goes off.
Booom!
Heh, there it is.
As of this evening, the fires which raged all night at Mako Reactor 1 have almost entirely been extinguished.
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: Emergency responders utilized a Shinra prototype fire suppression agent to bring the situation under control...
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: and as a precaution, access to affected areas is currently restricted.
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: We oughta be okay now that that fire's out.
That fire's finally out.
Thought for sure the whole city was gonna burn.
That stuff they used was pretty amazing.
You think the trains'll be running tomorrow?
The fire's finally under control.
At least the fire's out.
The roads are all blocked off now? Great.
Bless those firefighters.
I just wanna know if the trains'll run tomorrow.
Does this mean it's over now?
Who d'you think started 'em?
The fires are all out!
Do you think the trains'll be okay tomorrow?
Those bikes I serviced today seemed fine to me, but maybe I missed something?
They always push 'em right to the limit. If you didn't know your stuff, they'd be dead by now.
But...what if I don't?
I let you handle it 'cause you could. Have faith in yourself.
Thanks so much!
Man we gotta hit up Seventh Heaven tomorrow and have a drink with Tifa!
Sounds like a plan to me!
Just don't go hassling little Marlene unless you want Barret to give you the evil eye.
Woe betide the dumbass who dares!
A little trouble and I'm shaking in my boots. Get it together, man. Grow up already!
That does it. Tomorrow, I'm going to Seventh Heaven to talk to Tifa!
Hate to think we've really seen the last of Johnny boy...
Wherever you are, good luck...
Johnny, man...I don't know where life'll take him, but I hope he doesn't get caught up with the wrong girl.
I miss having him to talk to. He was a pretty good listener.
So Johnny really left town. Without him around, all of a sudden life just seems so dull.
I just get lonely sometimes. Can't get through a day without a drink in my hand.
We should go after him!
But he told us not to.
Did ya hear? Someone did a number on those thugs from Sector 6.
I sure hope they don't think it was me...
Trust me, they don't.
Long time ago I vowed to lay down my life for the don.
But you put all that behind you.
Guys like that, they don't care. I know they're out to get me!
You're being paranoid.
Heh heh... So this pigeon wants something to get rid of his cat allergies?
Easy enough to find─provided you think ditchwater counts as medicine.
Gotta think up a new angle or two.
Maybe there's money to be made with this whole reactor mess.
Heard that some of the don's men got their asses handed to 'em by a local merc.
Oh? You don't say.
Serious shitstorm's headed our way...
What's the don even after? If I've got information to sell, I need to know what it's worth.
Beats me. In fact, no one's got a clue.
Have to wait and see then.
Mako sure as shit ain't the key to untold happiness for one and all.
Learned that quick after coming here.
You saying you're cool with the bombings?
I'm saying Shinra could do more.
Thinking 'bout the planet dying keeps me up at night...
Hah, I dream about the sky falling!
Wish I could joke about it.
Uh... Sorry...
They standing me up again?
On a night when we could all use a drink...
Heard anything new about the reactor bombing?
No. I've been looking for that girl who was telling stories about Sector 8, but I haven't seen her anywhere...
Hope she comes back with more info from up on high.
Ain't worth the gil if you ask me, though.
Rumor has it there's a real sketchy shop on Culvert Street that's a front for Avalanche.
You sure? 'Cause I heard it was a salvage company or something they were using.
Prolly both, if you ask me.
White is the way to go!
More like pink!
A classic black-and-white combination never goes out of fashion.
But pink and red are like the go-to cute colors!
I'm telling you, if you just gave the black-and-white combo a shot, you'd totally understand what I'm talking about!
And you'd like pink with red if you tried it!
What we need is a pair of models to dress up and settle this once and for all!
What the hell are those two arguing about?
Slum fashion. As if anyone gives a shit.
If it's clean and fits...
There's some guy snooping around town, acting like he's here cruising for girls.
Wall Market fella, yeah? He tried to hit on you too?
Not me...
Guessing you weren't his type but, uh...you sure are mine.
Huh?
So you drinking?
I dunno...
If so, we've got quality stuff you won't find in Wall Market.
The traditional Loveless production they put on every year is great, but I'd also love to see this year's new musical version...
but which first?
Good question, but they're both totally worth it!
Wouldn't it be great to see the Loveless musical from a seat in the stalls?
You know they can go for as much as fifty grand!
I wonder's who's buying those seats. Maybe someone like President Shinra?
Keep them trains idle, says I! More'n happy to keep sittin' on my ass!
One more!
Food's dogshit, but I ain't here to eat!
Times like these you gotta live it up!
Really hope the trains'll be running tomorrow. Some of us've got bills to pay─and a big ol' tab to boot!
Well, if it ain't the new merc in town.
Could use a bruiser to help me make these deadbeats pay their tabs.
So you're the baby-faced merc Wedge was talking up? Looking good.
I might just have to call on ya if a customer of ours starts gettin' rowdy.
C'mon, let's get outta here. I know a great little nightclub where we can dance the night away.
I dunno. I kinda wanna check out Sector 6, don't you?
Uh... You talking about Wall Market?
I bet we could have lotsa fun.
Uhhh... Lemme just check my wallet...
You think that statement Avalanche put out is the real deal?
Whaddya mean?
Or was it faked by Wutai to destabilize Midgar before they invade?
There you go again...
When people find out I'm friends with someone who works at Shinra, they always look really impressed! It's so awesome!
data.speaker: Middle Manager's Friend

data.text: It's not a big deal.
data.speaker: Shinra Middle Manager

data.text: Imagine how they'll react when you're a department head! An executive! A board member, even! The president of the entire company!
data.speaker: Middle Manager's Friend

data.text: Ha! That'd be something.
data.speaker: Shinra Middle Manager

data.text: Have I told you lately just how much our friendship means to me?
data.speaker: Middle Manager's Friend

data.text: I even remember where we first met─at that one place in Wall Market.
data.speaker: Middle Manager's Friend

data.text: Right, but don't mention that to my wife.
data.speaker: Shinra Middle Manager

data.text: Don't worry─my lips are sealed.
data.speaker: Middle Manager's Friend

data.text: That one thing, oh, and that other thing... It'll all stay just between you and me.
data.speaker: Middle Manager's Friend

data.text: You saw it too, right? Over Scrap Boulevard?
N-not sure what I saw...
I don't wanna say it but... You don't think the place's haunted, do you?
Shut up. It was just your imagination, okay?
But you saw it, too! You did! Don't lie!
If it isn't the new merc in town.
Better watch yourself in there.
Quiet out here... Feels good after last night.
Think we'll have to fight Avalanche one of these days?
Swear I saw a shadow over Scrap Boulevard. Or maybe the long hours're getting to me.
If you find anything out of the ordinary, report it to the watch.
Truth is...I really hate fighting.
I'm not made for life on the front lines. I'm more of a support guy, bringing up the rear, y'know?
Hey, that new guy? Heard he's a vet.
Uh, you talking about the merc? He's not with the watch, to be clear.
Anyone who picks up a weapon to defend our town is a member of the watch, official or not.
Did you hear about the merc?
Apparently, he killed every last monster on Scrap Boulevard.
He must be one helluva fighter.
Think he'd be interested in a sidekick?
Word is, former reactor employees are going to the site to help clean it up─and rebuild the damn thing.
I wanna help. I bet they'd pay me if they saw the work I was putting in.
Good thinking! Count me in, too.
Can't kids these days think about anything besides money? There's more to life than gil.
If the trains are running tomorrow, I plan on going up to have a talk with the foreman.
Why don't I join you?
Me too!
You know about the secret reactor jobs? Even people from the undercity are allowed to do them.
Secret jobs?
It's just a rumor, but the pay's supposed to be amazing. Thing is, you can't apply―you have to be selected.
That sounds pretty sketchy, actually...
You know, there's serious money to be made working inside the reactors.
Not for us, though.
Wouldn't be so sure about that. Got a guy in Sector 6 who'll hook us up with a position if we're interested enough.
All right, I'm listening.
Somethin' about an experiment or something. Can't remember all the terms he used, but it's money.
Sure hope it'll be business as usual for Seventh Heaven tomorrow...
I'm always game for a second or third helping of Tifa's cooking!
I know I should head back up, but...
Topside's the place to be...even if I don't wanna.
Yeah, I'd like to go topside, but this bomb threat, man.
And just when the trains started moving again...
I just wanna know what the hell's going on up there.
Think any topsiders'll move on down here?
I could get on, but...should I?
I thought I was ready, but now that I'm here, I dunno...
My friend missed the train back the other day, so she oughta be coming home on this one.
I heard they're running on an "emergency schedule"?
Think they can pull it off again?
Who knows.
So which reactor's next?
Shame the Shinra creed isn't enough to keep all the trains running.
I reckon it's part of a plan to lure the bombers into a trap.
Yeah. Right.
Another day I couldn't make it to work... And after I begged my landlord to give me just one more day to make rent.
Wish I could help, but...
I'm screwed.
Even some of the folks who work topside've been hassling us to open up the graveyard.
Probably 'cause they're stuck down here. There's halfway decent money in scavenging for spare parts.
What a mess.
No way this deal goes through now.
You don't know that. War's still a possibility─there's plenty of talk.
If Avalanche keeps this up, I dunno what I'll do.
No getting by without mako?
Not for me. Shinra better bring those terrorists to justice.
I...I can't wait any longer!
It's okay. I'm ready.
You finally said it. I'm so happy.
Me too!
Right...
Let's...
Zzz...
Zzz...
It's pretty hard to sleep standing up.
Yeah...
Do you even know anyone that works topside?
Few morning regulars got Shinra jobs. Think they caught a train before all this.
Here's hoping they make it home safe.
Rain or shine, Shinra expects people to come in.
Of all the days to head up top.
Even so...gotta catch the next one for Sector 2.
If I don't make it back, promise me you'll go see Biggs, okay? He'll take you to the Leaf House.
Okay.
You'll like it. Everyone's really nice─especially the teachers.
Next shipment oughta come in sometime today.
So glad some food's starting to trickle back in.
And once Shinra stops Avalanche and the bombings, we'll finally have some peace and quiet.
I had no idea the food down here was so good!
You know...we can always head back up tomorrow!
Shinra will put a stop to the bombings soon enough.
Absolutely. No reason not to go home tomorrow.
You headed topside?
Still thinking about it.
If Shinra caves, then I guess we'll have to make do without mako.
Ain't no kind of life worth living.
Maybe a slum slider for lunch─with a triple serving of black milly to boot!
That flavor, that heavenly scent! Ahh, just thinking about it's enough to make my mouth water!
And just when the trains started running again...
You think they're gonna catch Avalanche this time?
Have a good day at work, Daddy!
data.speaker: Middle Manager's Daughter

data.text: I will. Thanks, honey. I'll pick up something sweet on the way home.
data.speaker: Shinra Middle Manager

data.text: Yay! Thanks, Daddy!
data.speaker: Middle Manager's Daughter

data.text: That Avalanche... Do you think they'll try to destroy any more of our reactors?
data.speaker: Middle Manager's Wife

data.text: Even if they do, Shinra will be there to protect everyone, right?
data.speaker: Middle Manager's Daughter

data.text: That's right, honey!
data.speaker: Shinra Middle Manager

data.text: If I bump into these Avalanche guys, I'll talk sense into them.
data.speaker: Shinra Middle Manager

data.text: Good for you, dear! You show them who's in charge!
data.speaker: Middle Manager's Wife

data.text: Oh, fancy meeting you here.
data.speaker: Johnny's Father

data.text: Wait a minute, don't tell me. You're leaving town too, aren't you? Yeah, I can tell by that look on your face.
data.speaker: Johnny's Father

data.text: You youngsters─the ones with a fire in your heart─I can see it in your eyes, burning brightly.
data.speaker: Johnny's Father

data.text: For old men like me, well, our job is to see ya off.
data.speaker: Johnny's Father

data.text: I know he had to go, I-I really do. But that doesn't stop me from feeling sad that he's gone.
data.speaker: Johnny's Father

data.text: So sad in fact that my wife and I were talking about taking a little trip ourselves. You know, to make sure that Johnny's doing all right out there.
data.speaker: Johnny's Father

data.text: My Johnny said he was leaving town and headed off somewhere on his own...
data.speaker: Johnny's Mother

data.text: But he left so many of his things behind. I should make sure he has what he needs.
data.speaker: Johnny's Mother

data.text: That boy can't sleep without his lucky pillow. And he even forgot his favorite toothbrush! Oh, how will he survive out there?
data.speaker: Johnny's Mother

data.text: I can see him now, crying in his hotel room...
data.speaker: Johnny's Mother

data.text: Whatever happens, I believe in Shinra!
Yeah, Shinra for life!
No one's telling me not to use mako!
More bombings might force people to stop taking the planet for granted.
That's going too far!
Tell it to Shinra!
Thing's junk through and through, even without the rust.
Nothing but duds today, seems like.
Someone was on our turf yesterday, salvagin' our scrap and stealing our profits.
Maybe start keeping watch?
Guess we gotta...
It kinda feels like we're at war.
I hate to say it, but if we've got to decide between us and the planet, well...
Anyway, better keep an eye on the news today.
Sir...
data.speaker: New Recruit

data.text: I got my hands on tickets for the Loveless musical. Would you like to go with me?
data.speaker: New Recruit

data.text: You do realize, we're on duty.
data.speaker: Senior Officer

data.text: The slums are Avalanche territory. Stay sharp.
data.speaker: Senior Officer

data.text: Right. Sorry, sir! It's just that...never mind.
data.speaker: New Recruit

data.text: I heard they've deployed SOLDIER operatives, too. It's been a while since they'd done that.
data.speaker: New Recruit

data.text: I wanted to be a SOLDIER, but as you can see─
data.speaker: New Recruit

data.text: Cut the chatter. We're working!
data.speaker: Senior Officer

data.text: Right! Sorry, sir.
data.speaker: New Recruit

data.text: I don't know who's scarier─Avalanche or my superior.
data.speaker: New Recruit

data.text: Oh, man... A bomb threat? I'm not ready for this...
data.speaker: New Recruit

data.text: Seen anything suspicious?
data.speaker: Senior Officer

data.text: You're not Avalanche, are you?
data.speaker: Senior Officer

data.text: You really think there'll be more bombings?
I don't even wanna think about it! It's freaking me out!
You heard the TV, didn't you? War's on the way.
No way I'm going topside now.
Avalanche is the real enemy, I say.
Screw them sons of bitches!
Which reactor you think they'll hit next?
What's so bad about using mako, anyhow?
News about that bomb threat spread pretty damn fast, don't you think?
On the news one second, on everybody's lips the next. Weird, huh?
Avalanche's fighting to save the planet.
Imagine it; a world without any mako reactors.
You really think they'll bomb another one?
People are saying this could be war, but...they're not serious.
You see the news earlier?
I hate thinking that Avalanche won.
Thing is, how are we supposed to live without mako?
They say it's an absolute mess up top.
I hate to think what's coming next...
Those topsiders must be absolutely terrified.
So everyone knows about the bomb threat? Really?
Weird. I'm usually the first one to catch wind of this stuff, but somehow I missed out this time.
We've gotta stop relying on mako so much.
Shinra needs to think about where all of this is going.
Moving down under and "slumming it" is the latest fad.
Hah! Like any topsider would ditch the good life to see how the "better half" live.
What sector's gonna get it next?
Please let it be anywhere but 7 or 8.
Bombs and stuff are scary, huh?
Everyone should just come down here. It's safe.
Think they'll really bomb another one?
Shinra'll stop 'em.
God I hope so.
That ruckus down at Seventh Heaven was something else. Been a while since monsters got that deep into the slums.
How the hell it happened I do not know.
Watch really dropped the ball on that one.
In a press conference that was held earlier today...
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: Shinra representatives announced that they received a bomb threat from the eco-terrorist group, Avalanche.
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: President Shinra had this to say:
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: "Avalanche has declared war on our way of life and all who have chosen to embrace the miracle of mako energy."
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: "Have faith, my friends, for together we will overcome this trial."
data.speaker: Announcer
